ideal_answer: The primary challenge is the detection and management of liver diseases in resource-limited areas like rural Bangladesh.

question: Why is liver disease a major concern in Bangladesh?
ideal_answer: Due to high prevalence of Hepatitis B and C and limited access to healthcare in rural regions.
generated_answer: Liver disease is a major concern in Bangladesh because it is one of the most densely populated countries in the world and faces significant challenges in managing the health of its population. The situation is made considerably worse by the increase in viral illnesses like Hepatitis B and C as well as the restricted availability of medical facilities.
